results.title: Fun for all
results.brief_description: Car Crazy: On an airstrip at Abbotsford, near Vancouver, young hot-rodders indulge their speed craze with the approval of policemen. Trappers at Play: The Pas, in northern Manitoba, stages the annual Trappers’ Festival. Lumberjack’s Picnic: Vancouver Island forestry champions compete and compare know-how.

results.title: Fun fancy free
results.creator_credit: Bill Robert, Hamilton Luske, Jack Kinney, Ben Sharpsteen, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Essentially two shorts, these charming animated child orientated tales are hosted by perennial Disney favourite Jiminey Cricket. The first, “Bongo” is a musical about an escaped circus bear searching for love and meaning in life and the second, “Mickey and the beanstalk” is based on “Jack and the beanstalk”. Features the voices of Edgar Bergen, Dinah Shore, Luana Patten, The Dinning Sisters, Clarence Nash, and Walt Disney. This was Walt Disney’s last film as the voice of Mickey.

results.title: Full time killer = Fulltime killer = Chuen jik sat sau
results.creator_credit: Johnnie To, Ka-Fai Wai, Andrew Lau and Milky Way Productions
results.brief_description: Two professional assassins engage in a battle of wits as they vie for the title of Asia’s number one hitman. Tok (Andy Lau), is an up-and-coming professional with an extravagant and flamboyant style, given to copying schemes of mass destruction from the movies and possessed of a diabolical wit. His antagonist is the Japanese-speaking O (Takashi Sorimachi), a discrete and efficient hitman who single-mindedly carries out his lethal tasks then fades into obscurity. The two men are preoccupied with the same woman, Chin (Kelly Lin), who, while Chinese, speaks fluent Japanese and runs a video store that rents films from Japan. Through a series of bloody encounters that take place across Asia, the assassins find themselves both allies and enemies, their rivalry culminating in fateful showdown. With ‘Fulltime Killer’ Johnnie To, a specialist of action cinema whose heterogeneous work oscillates between the grotesque (The Heroic Trio) and the minimalist (The Mission), has co-directed a crazed, exciting homage to the ‘bullet ballet’ sub-genre, laden with self-reflexive references and illogical narrative leaps. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Fuels and heat: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: Explains the funtion of carbon in fuels, the manufacture and storage of carbohydrates in plants, the origin of coal and oil, and the method employed by man to utilise them. Combustion, and molecular action as affect the relation of hear to temperature, and the operation of steam and internal combustion engines are demonstrated by animated diagrams.

results.title: Fuelling Up (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This program aims to teach young people that diet does not mean the complete denial of nice things to eat, but rather the controlled, planned intake of good quality food - the fuel necessary to power life. Rated: G

results.title: Frozen gold of the Klondike
results.creator_credit: Christina L McCaughey, Film Factory and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A lively historical look at gold mining in the Klondike from gold-rush days to the present using archival stills and footage.

results.title: Frozen asset
results.brief_description: The delicate and awe-inspiring environment of Antarctica is threatened by unrestricted tourism, oil and mineral exploration, and the competing territorial claims of several nations. The program explores several of the most pressing issues, including whaling, the inadequacies of the Antarctic Treaty, and the intended legitimisation of mining by the minerals convention.

results.title: Frost
results.creator_credit: J.A.D. Cartwright and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Severe frosts coming in the late spring can create havoc in the orchard. Various ways of protecting fruit trees against frost damage have been tried. However, the best protection available at present is probably that derived from a knowledge of how cold air behaves; the orchard can then be planned so that the layer of cold air runs away from the orchard, and frost pockets are avoided.

results.title: Frontline education kit No.2
results.creator_credit: Jane Kennedy, Rob Sitch, Santo Cilauro, Tom Gleisner, ABC-TV (Australia) and Frontline Television Productions
results.brief_description: This tape contains two episodes of the ‘Frontline’ series. ‘Heroes and villains’, tables turn when a book publishing company manipulates the media generally and Frontline in particular to portray a dull textbook as a racially potent controversy and gain publicity, the irony being that Mike Moore is more homophobic than the book’s author! ‘Keeping up appearances’, Mike has a P.R. nightmare: he’s the subject of a front cover story in the first issue of Brave - a new gay magazine. Jan’s efforts to change his image lands Mike in several ludicrous situations. On the other hand the plight of a disfigured prostitute is a public relations and ratings triumph for Frontline, though Brooke seems far more interested in her own appearance prior to a Lachlan Murdoch interview than with the woman’s facial injuries. Roleplay game “Newsflash” and “Frontline” script included.

results.title: Frontline education kit No.1
results.creator_credit: Jane Kennedy, Rob Sitch, Santo Cilauro, Tom Gleisner, ABC-TV (Australia) and Frontline Television Productions
results.brief_description: Behind the Frontline is a behind the scenes look at the process by which a single episode of ‘Frontline’ is put together. All aspects of the pre-production, production and post-production process are examined, from casting to editing. This tape also includes the completed episode. ‘Divide the community, multiply the ratings’ sees a slow news day which is shattered by racial violence in the community, which Frontline is more than happy to encourage - even to the point of cultivating conflict in a televised debate and defying the police requests not to inflame community tension! Roleplay game “Newsflash” and “Frontline” script included.
